Event.name: See_through
Event.definition: <def-root>A <fen>Cognizer</fen> realizes that a <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> (or Focal_entity within the <fen>State_of_affairs</fen>) is meant to deceive (the <fen>Cognizer</fen> is not necessarily the intended victim of the deception). The <fen>Cognizer</fen> comes to this belief by perception and reasoning, and not, for instance, by being informed of the true state of affairs.</def-root>

Arg.name: Cognizer
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Cognizer</fen> realizes the existence of a deception and is not misled by it.</def-root>

Arg.name: State_of_affairs
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> is intended to be perceived and taken to be true even though it is not.</def-root>

Arg.name: Focal_entity
Arg.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Focal_entity</fen> is a part of the deception (possibly also the agent behind it) which is perceived by the <fen>Cognizer</fen> to be misleading.</def-root>

Arg.name: Means
Arg.definition: <def-root>An act performed by the Cognizer which enables them to figure something out. </def-root>

Arg.name: Medium
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Medium is the text created by the Cognizer to communicate that they came to believe a specified State_of_affairs.
</def-root>

Arg.name: Topic
Arg.definition: <def-root>Some verbs in this frame may occur with postverbal Topic expressions</def-root>

Arg.name: Degree
Arg.definition: <def-root>The Degree to which the Cognizer comes to understand the State_of_affairs. </def-root>

Arg.name: Place
Arg.definition: <def-root>The location at which the Cognizer realizes the State_of_affairs. </def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition: <def-root>The time at which the Cognizer discovers the State_of_affairs. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: see (through).v
lexUnit.definition: FN: understand that someone is attempting to deceive.
